text: Bhumika Chawla (born Rachna Chawla; 21 August 1978) is an Indian actress and a former model known for her work mostly in Telugu, Hindi, and Tamil movies. Her first movie role was in the Telugu movie Yuvakudu (2000). Since then, she has worked in over fifty movies in various Indian languages. Her notable performances include appearances in movies such as Kushi (2001), Okkadu (2003), Tere Naam (2003), Missamma (2003), Sillunu Oru Kaadhal (2006), Gandhi, My Father (2007), Anasuya (2007), Buddy (2013), M.S. Dhoni: The Untold Story (2016 ), MCA (2017), and U Turn (2018). She has won four Nandi Awards, one Filmfare Awards South, one SIIMA award, one Zee Cine award, and one Zee Apsara award. == Early life == Chawla was born in a Punjabi family in New Delhi, India and completed her schooling there. Her father is a retired Army officer. Bhumika has two siblings, an elder brother and sister. She moved to Mumbai in 1997 and started her career with Ad films and Hindi music video albums. She appeared in the Zee TV series Hip Hip Hurray and Star Best Sellers - Fursat Mein. == Personal life == Chawla married her long-time boyfriend and yoga teacher Bharat Thakur on 21 October 2007 at Devlali, Nashik in a Gurdwara. She went regularly to Thakur's courses and is said to have dated him for four years before marrying him. The couple has a son born in February 2014. == Other websites == *Bhumika Chawla at IMDb == References == Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Indian actors
title: Bhumika Chawla
